questions.question: Soon the gloves were ........................... and they started screaming at each other.
questions.description: When the gloves are off, people start fighting in a more hostile way.

questions.question: They work hand in ...............................
questions.description: When people work hand in glove, they work in close cooperation.

questions.question: She was dressed to the ............................... and made her friends jealous of her looks.
questions.description: When you are dressed to the nines, you wear very smart clothes.

questions.question: He can spend money like water. His parents have ...................................... pockets.
questions.description: To have deep pockets is to be very rich.

questions.question: To keep something under your ................................. is to keep it secret.
That jacket is too large. You should find one that fits like a ..................................
questions.description: If something fits like a glove, it fits perfectly.

questions.question: I have a few tricks up my ................................... should he take action against me.
questions.description: A trick up your sleeve is a secret plan or idea.

questions.question: I am sure he will fail the test, but if he passes, I will eat my ..............................
questions.description: This is an expression used to suggest that something is not going to happen.

questions.question: When I started out I knew nothing about acting and I was just ……………………….. by the seat of my pants.
questions.description: To fly by the seat of your pants is to rely on your instinct because you have no experience.

questions.question: I must leave now. I have bigger .............................. to fry.
questions.description: To have bigger fish to fry is to have more important things to do.

questions.question: My uncle used to drink like a ................................ so we were not surprised when he developed liver trouble.
questions.description: To drink like a fish is to have a problem with alcohol.

questions.question: When she started talking about her ex-boyfriends, he looked like a ........................................ out of water.
questions.description: To be a fish out of water is to struggle in an unfamiliar or uncomfortable environment.
